entry.title: A short documentary on YoungInnovations #tbt
entry.content:
Here’s a short documentary on YoungInnovations prepared by students of KCM as one of their academic projects. It has been more than 2 and half years and lot of things have changed here.

The visible changes are the faces seen in the video. Some have gone for their higher education abroad, some have joined other companies and some have started their own companies. Although they are, now, not here but we proudly express that their contributions are valuable and have shaped our company that it is today. We always cherish the time they spent here - their hardship, ideas, success, failure, knowledge and happy and sad moments.

The other change is that we have shifted to new building at Kumaripati with many young and enthusiastic people - some starting their career and some sharing their past experiences to take YoungInnovations to new beginning.

Of course, the working style have also changed adapting to the needs of the new projects and increase in the number of YIPLites resulting different teams. However, the team spirit is same as before. Each team member has equal opportunities and challenges in completing projects. As our CEO, Bibhusan, expresses, “We work hard and we party harder”, all the YIPLites are actively involved in fun activities too.

Changes are inevitable. YoungInnovations has changed and will change in future and each of us is working together for the best of each and YoungInnovations.

A short documentary on YoungInnovations #tbt was originally published by YoungInnovations Blog at YoungInnovations Blog on August 13, 2015.

entry.title: Young Innovations weekly #1
entry.content:
We recently had our annual retreat, everyone at YIPL enjoyed a relaxed mood from their daily work and had loads of fun. Sneak peak below:

This is our first weekly at YIPL which has links to blogs, posts, articles and podcasts. We aim to continue this so that YIPLies can share things they read over the week and found useful which can benefit a larger tech community.

Enjoy! the techy links with a hot tea in this rain over the weekend. Happy Weekend!!

Links:

  • /r for everything android (dev)

  • 365 days of cultural kaisen

  • 500px engineering blog

  • 7 cool tricks with chrome devtools

  • 7 things you didn’t know about javascript — just javascript — medium

  • a docker image with php and composer build on alpine linux - size 39mb

  • an overview of software testing

  • android best practices

  • awesome php - a curated list of amazingly awesome php libraries, resources and shiny things

  • cultivating a code review culture // speaker deck

  • defensive programming in php

  • designing simple pie chart with css

  • docker is coming whether you like it or not

  • don’t test with sqllite when you use postgres in production

  • eloquent date filtering: wheredate() and other methods - laravel daily

  • enigmatic foundations of maths put to music : nature news

  • episode 32: adam wathan is strong

  • friendsofphp/goutte

  • full stack radio

  • hola — a widely popular free vpn service used as a giant botnet

  • how to extract actual addresses from hyperlinks in excel?

  • how to set up your mac for local php development - eric l. barnes

  • introduction to elasticsearch in php

  • laravel elixir version 3 is released - laravel news

  • login throttling in laravel 5.1 - matt stauffer on laravel, php, frontend development

  • on unit testing — medium

  • one in every 600 websites has .git exposed

  • podcasts for all things java

  • rxjava

  • unit test node code in 10 seconds

  • way we work — medium engineering — medium

  • webassembly: a binary format for the web

  • website speed test

  • why i’m the best programmer in the world*

Young Innovations weekly #1 was originally published by YoungInnovations Blog at YoungInnovations Blog on August 07, 2015.
